tool.name: SAGA.grid_tools.39
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayPOINTS False isArrayGRID False output_data_GRID_OUT $output_data_GRID_OUT name SAGA.grid_tools.39 POINTS $POINTS GRID $GRID REPLACE $REPLACE REPLACE_VALUE $REPLACE_VALUE TOLERANCE $TOLERANCE IGNORE_NODATA $IGNORE_NODATA FILL_NODATA $FILL_NODATA FILL_VALUE $FILL_VALUE prefer $prefer response $response outputType_GRID_OUT $OutputSection_GRID_OUT.outputType_GRID_OUT transmissionMode_GRID_OUT $OutputSection_GRID_OUT.transmissionMode_GRID_OUT

param.name: POINTS
param.label: Points
param.help: Points The following data types are allowed in the txt file: vnd.google-earth.kml+xml, json, xml

param.name: GRID
param.label: Grid
param.help: Grid The following data types are allowed in the txt file: png, tiff, x-ogc-envi, x-ogc-aaigrid

param.name: REPLACE_VALUE
param.label: Fixed value to be replaced
param.help: Replace only this value with respect to the specified tolerance.

param.name: IGNORE_NODATA
param.label: Ignore No-Data
param.help: Do not fill areas representing no-data.

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_GRID_OUT
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format and the output value

tool.help: A flood fill algorithm will be used for replacement of grid cell values starting at the positions of the input points. If one or more points are selected, only these will be processed, otherwise all. If the target grid is not set, the changes will be applied to the original grid.
